Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

ALLEGATION: During restraint, resident started to self-harm by banging his head
on the floor. Staff member did not follow the protocol for personal restraint.
INVESTIGATION:
Administrator 1 self-reported that an improper restraint was implemented on Youth A
and Youth A self-harmed during the incident. Youth A experienced a bloody nose
during the incident, but otherwise had no injury.
Administrator 1 was interviewed by telephone on 03/23/2020. Administrator 1 reported
Youth A was involved in a peer conflict with another resident. Staff 1 intervened in the
incident and attempted to restrain Youth A when Youth A tried to punch the other
2

resident. Administrator 1 reported Youth A was resistant and continued to hit, bite, and
kick. Staff 1 was unable to implement a proper restraint and Youth A fell to the floor and
started to self-harm by banging his own head on the floor causing a bloody nose. Youth
A was on the floor in a prone position during the restraint. The restraint lasted for
approximately 15 minutes. Staff 1 attempted to hold the head of Youth A to keep Youth
A from self-harming. Administrator 1 stated Youth A was taken for medical treatment
following the restraint and no injuries were noted. Administrator 1 stated a nurse
interviewed Youth A, and X-Rays were taken that revealed Youth A did not have any
fractures. Administrator 1 stated there was a video of the incident that was reviewed by
Administrator 1 but was not able to be sent for my review. Administrator 1 stated the
implementation of the restraint was not consistent with the behavior management
restraint training of the facility because Youth A was restrained in a prone position
instead of a supine position when Youth A was on the floor.
Administrator 1 submitted medical information related to the incident. The medical
information documented the diagnosis that Youth A did not have any fractures as a
result of the incident. Administrator 1 also submitted the behavior management training
record for Staff 1. Staff 1 last completed behavior management training on 05/10/2019.
A telephone conference was completed on 03/27/2020 with State Worker 1 and the
foster care worker for Youth A. The foster care worker for Youth A stated she had
discussed the incident with Youth A and Youth A downplayed any issues with staff and
did not make any allegations of mistreatment involving Staff 1.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4157 Behavior management.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies
and procedures that describe the institution’s behavior
management system. The policies and procedures shall be
reviewed annually and updated as needed. These shall be
available to all residents, their families, and referring
agencies.
ANALYSIS: The findings of this investigation substantiate that Staff 1
implemented an improper restraint of Youth A by restraining
Youth A in a prone position. Administrator 1 stated that her
video review confirmed the restraint was inconsistent with the
behavior management/restraint training provided by the facility.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
